description: The Rensselaer Orchestra, under the direction of Nicholas DeMaison, presents its annual Fall concert.
title: Rensselaer Orchestra Fall Concert Among Upcoming iEAR Events

description: Description: Distinguished artist-in-residence Laurie Anderson presents a feature film in the form of a personal essay, with an original soundtrack of new music and a discussion following the screening.
title: Laurie Anderson to Present New Film at EMPAC

description: Description:RPI-Sage Hillel will be hosting a shabbat dinner for the whole student and faculty community. The food is home-cooked and served at no cost, and newcomers are always welcome! Optional services start at 5:30pm; dinner starts at 6:00pm.
title: Hillel to Host Shabbat Dinner

description: The first Music and Science presentation will take place at the CBIS auditorium from noon to 1:00 Nov. 20th featuring Shakir Khan demonstrating the practice of aural transmission in Guru/Shishya Parampara, the tradition and lineage of knowledge in Hindustani classical music.    Khan will also perform a concert at CBIS Nov. 21st at 7:00 pm
title: HASS, CBIS to Hold First "Music and Science" Presentation and Concert

description: Description: Dr. Tugrul Ozel of Rutgers University will present "Integrated Physics Based Modeling and Multi-objective Optimization Approach for Micro-milling Titanium Alloy."
title: Dept. of MANE Colloquium Scheduled for December 3

description: Description: Speaker Dr. Dominic Di Tori of NAE, will present "Modern Models for Predicting Partitioning, Bioconcentration, and Toxicity of Organic Chemicals: The End of the Age of Octanol"
title: C & EE Seminar to be Held December 10

description: Description: As part of their end-of-term celebration, student creative writers will be reading excerpts of their short story work.   This event is free and open to the public, and all are welcome to attend!  Refreshments will be served.
title: Student Writers to Mark End of Semester with Short Story Readings

description: Description: TIAA-CREF Individual Client Services Consultant Peter Crehan will be on campus for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer's retirement plan benefits!
title: TIAA-CREF to Offer Confidential Retirement Counseling December 9

description: Description: President Shirley Ann Jackson invites all faculty, staff, and students to the Annual Campus Seasonal Celebration.  Lunch will be served.  Limited parking is available.
title: Annual Campus Seasonal Celebration to be Held December 9

description: Description: With this week's Super November Special at the RPI Bookstore, you can get 30% off all winter hats this Thursday through Saturday.  Stay warm with their great selection of winter hats for men, women and children!
title: RPI Bookstore Continues Super November Specials

description: Description: Jim Kurose, of the Department of Computer Science at University of Massachusetts Amherst, will present "Design and Analysis of Content Caching Networks." Refreshments will be served at 3:30 PM.
title: Douglas Mercer '77 ECSE Lecture Series Continues November 19

description: Description: Terra Cafe's last lunch for the fall 2014 semester will feature Aussie Meat Pie, filled with your choice of lamb and beef or seitan, mixed with potatoes, carrots, peas, onions, and topped with gravy.  Each entree comes with drinks, a side salad, and dessert...all for only $7.00!
title: Terra Cafe Serving Last Lunch for Fall Semester

description: Students from the HASS Inquiry course "Worlds on Display" present exhibits for their final projects examining Worlds Fairs and Expositions through the lenses of technology, futurism, design, architecture, anthropology, history and art.
title: HASS Students to Present "Expo 14: Worlds on Display"

description: Description: Every Friday morning through Friday, December 5, Sigma Phi Epsilon will be selling bacon, egg, and cheese sandwiches for only $2. Sandwiches are cooked on location and are hot and ready to go for a fast breakfast on your way to or from class!
title: Breakfast Sandwich Sales to Benefit Big Brothers Big Sisters

description: Description: Every Friday morning through Friday, December 5, Sigma Phi Epsilon will be selling bacon, egg, and cheese sandwiches for only $2. Sandwiches are cooked on location and are hot and ready to go for a fast breakfast on your way to or from class!
title: Breakfast Sandwich Sales to Benefit Big Brothers Big Sisters

description: Description: The speaker is Dr. Nicole Immorlica from Microsoft Research New England, and the title of her talk is, "Tilting at Windmills: The Economic Performance of Markets in the Wild."  Refreshments will be served at 3:30 p.m.
title: Computer Science Colloquium to be Held November 25

description: Description: All members of the campus community are welcome to stop by the DCC Great Hall and learn more about what the Rensselaer Center for Open Source (RCOS) students have accomplished this semester.  This is a great opportunity to see a variety of open source projects and tools, many of which are already available for use, as well as provide your input and feedback.  Live project demos throughout the day.  No RSVP required....just stop by!
title: RCOS Poster Session Slated for November 19

description: Description: ** Regrettably, Dr. H. Michael Zhang's presentation, "From Human Drivers to Robo Cars: Traffic Flow in the Era of Autonomous Vehicles," which was originally scheduled for Wednesday, November 19, has been cancelled. **
title: UPDATE: November 19 C & EE Seminar CANCELLED

description: Come hear game designers and visionaries Erin Hoffman and Paul Neurath reflect on games both commercial and applied in a revealing, provocative discussion of the game industry of yesterday, today and tomorrow.
title: HASS Event, "Two Paths. Two Experts. One Conversation," Scheduled for November 17

description: Description: Fall 2014 course evaluations are now open. Your feedback is very important to the Institute, its five schools, and their departments, so please complete evaluation surveys for all your courses!  Evaluations will be available through Friday, December 5, 2014.
title: Fall 2014 Student Course Evaluations Now Open
